p: The known hopane type triterpenoids; betulin ( 171) and lupeol ( 172) (Fig. 36) were isolated from the stem bark of Diospyros canaliculata (Ebenaceae) and Erythrina caffra (Papilionaceae), respectively [ 90, 106]. These triterpenoids only exhibited weak activities against the NF54 strain, with IC 50 values of 112.94 and 97.73 μM, respectively [ 90, 106]. The cycloartane-type triterpenoid 22-de- O-acetyl-26-deoxyneoboutomellerone ( 173) was isolated from the stem bark of Neoboutonia macrocalyx (Euphorbaceae) [ 96]. The compound potently inhibited the CQ-resistant FcB1/Colombia strain of P. falciparum, with IC 50 value of 2.15 µM [ 96].
